data.title: API to read and write a configuration value given a resource
data.body: MR workspaces introduced Folder configurations for resources under root folders. This is to track implementation of the API to read and write configuration given a resource.

data.title: Reflect squiggle and other colors at scrollbar
data.body:
VS Code: 1.14.2
Squiggle color is changed but it is still showing green at scrollbar.
Caret color is reflected but squiggle colors aren't.
![screenshot 231](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26769888/28556053-46edf500-7121-11e7-9f24-aca8d4cc17d1.png)

data.title: Multiple desktop issue
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->
Multiple desktop issue
<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.14.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open VSCode
2. Fixed VSCode to taskbar
3. Press *Win + tab* to switch other desktop
4. Press *Win + 2* to Switch VSCode
5. It will open a new instance of VSCode. **I want to open old VSCode like *Sublime Text***

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Test Markdown Extensions API
data.body:
Test for #22916

**Size**: 2
**OS**:
- [x] Linux @chrisdias 
- [x] Mac @Lixire 
- [x] Windows @rebornix 

## Scenario
This update adds an API for extensions to extend VSCode's builtin markdown preview. The new API is described here: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-docs/blob/vnext/docs/extensionAPI/api-markdown.md

## Testing
- Try out a few of the example markdown extension linked from the preview.
- Verify you can enable and disable these extensions as expected
- Verify these extensions work properly in multi-root scenarios and single file scenarios
- Change the markdown security settings and verity you do not see any content warnings and that the markdown extensions continue to work

data.title: Debugger frequently fails to connect to extension host
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.15.0-insider (9b6cc9f774f424b4e8a91d4a2d3d4ad8efb9cfb9, 2017-07-24T05:16:28.556Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 6.1.7601
- Extensions: none
---

**Steps to Reproduce:**

1. Open an extension folder and start debugging a client
2. Wait for the extension to actually start
3. Close the extension host
4. Start debugging the client again
5. Repeat steps 2 through 4 until it fails to connect

**Notes:**

- It doesn't always happen, but I can usually reproduce it after 2-3 tries.

data.title: Incorrect multiline implementation peek
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.15.0-insider (9b6cc9f774f424b4e8a91d4a2d3d4ad8efb9cfb9, 2017-07-24T05:07:43.734Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.6.0
---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open `vscode.d.ts`
2. Run `go to implementation` on `Command`

**bug**
![screen shot 2017-07-24 at 5 19 08 pm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12821956/28550212-3ee71fae-7094-11e7-9aa2-8f596227e84c.png)

In `extHostCommand.ts`, the text preview on the right side is off. It shows part of `return` twice

data.title: Cannot read property 'roots' of null, after closing folder
data.body:
**Version**: 58332b486e7e5196f4b21edc93081686c0509e55
**OS**: Mac 10.12.5

**Repo**
1. Open a folder using the file menu
1. Close the folder using the file menu

**Bug**
```
Cannot read property 'roots' of null: TypeError: Cannot read property 'roots' of null
    at ConfigurationManager.initLaunches (file:///Users/matb/projects/vscode/out/vs/workbench/parts/debug/electron-browser/debugConfigurationManager.js:258:63)
    at new ConfigurationManager (file:///Users/matb/projects/vscode/out/vs/workbench/parts/debug/electron-browser/debugConfigurationManager.js:201:18)
    at create (file:///Users/matb/projects/vscode/out/vs/base/common/types.js:164:14)
    at InstantiationService._createInstance (file:///Users/matb/projects/vscode/out/vs/platform/instantiation/common/instantiationService.js:143:43)
    at InstantiationService.createInstance (file:///Users/matb/projects/vscode/out/vs/platform/instantiation/common/instantiationService.js:71:29)
    at new DebugService (file:///Users/matb/projects/vscode/out/vs/workbench/parts/debug/electron-browser/debugService.js:53:67)
    at create (file:///Users/matb/projects/vscode/out/vs/base/common/types.js:164:14)
    at InstantiationService._createInstance (file:///Users/matb/projects/vscode/out/vs/platform/instantiation/common/instantiationService.js:143:43)
    at InstantiationService._createAndCacheServiceInstance (file:///Users/matb/projects/vscode/out/vs/platform/instantiation/common/instantiationService.js:202:41)
    at InstantiationService._getOrCreateServiceInstance (file:///Users/matb/projects/vscode/out/vs/platform/instantiation/common/instantiationService.js:150:29)
```

data.title: code slows my mac to a halt on encountering a single line of php code
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.2 (cb82febafda0c8c199b9201ad274e25d9a76874e, 2017-07-19T23:22:50.650Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 14.5.0
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
html-class-suggestions|And|1.0.7
dart-code|Dan|2.3.1
beautify|Hoo|1.1.1
laravel-blade|KTa|0.0.1
format-indent|Kas|1.3.0
vscode-html-scss|P-d|0.0.42
material-icon-theme|PKi|2.0.11
nativescript|Tel|0.7.2
vscode-eslint|dba|1.2.11
githistory|don|0.2.2
tslint|eg2|0.17.0
vscode-npm-script|eg2|0.2.0
git-project-manager|fel|1.3.2
php-debug|fel|1.11.1
php-intellisense|fel|1.4.3
php-pack|fel|1.0.1
fs-flutter-snippets|fra|0.1.3
phpcs|ika|0.7.0
vscode-icon-theme|jtl|1.5.0
vscode-JS-CSS-HTML-formatter|lon|0.2.3
Go|luk|0.6.62
vscode-pugbeautify|mrm|1.0.2
vetur|oct|0.9.3
vue|sea|0.4.2



---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a simple laravel project
2. Create any controller method and type `return response()->json($foo);`

Code highlights the above php snippet as having a syntax error (even though that is not correct) and after a few minutes, my mac will completely slow down to a halt. I always have to do a hard shut down :(

I have run into this problem countless of times in this past few days for me to be very sure of this. Please fix this issue. Its rather annoying to have to restart my mac every now and then just for a seemingly simple line of php code. 

Thanks for making such a wonderful companion guys!

data.title: Cannot read property 'offset' of undefined, when updating configuration
data.body:
For the following extension code:

```ts
const tsConfig = workspace.getConfiguration('typescript');
await tsConfig.update('tsdk', 'abc', false);
```

I'm seeing this error when the users has only opened a folder instead of a workspace:

```
TypeError: Cannot read property 'offset' of undefined
    at ConfigurationEditingService.applyEditsToBuffer (file:///Users/matb/projects/vscode/out/vs/workbench/services/configuration/node/configurationEditingService.js:59:57)
    at ConfigurationEditingService.writeToBuffer (file:///Users/matb/projects/vscode/out/vs/workbench/services/configuration/node/configurationEditingService.js:52:22)
    at file:///Users/matb/projects/vscode/out/vs/workbench/services/configuration/node/configurationEditingService.js:47:59
    at Object.notifySuccess [as _notify] (file:///Users/matb/projects/vscode/out/vs/base/common/winjs.base.raw.js:1170:59)
    at Object.enter (file:///Users/matb/projects/vscode/out/vs/base/common/winjs.base.raw.js:852:30)
    at _Base.Class.derive._creator._run (file:///Users/matb/projects/vscode/out/vs/base/common/winjs.base.raw.js:1068:29)
    at _Base.Class.derive._creator._completed (file:///Users/matb/projects/vscode/out/vs/base/common/winjs.base.raw.js:1036:18)
    at CompletePromise_ctor.CompletePromise_then [as then] (file:///Users/matb/projects/vscode/out/vs/base/common/winjs.base.raw.js:1566:49)
    at Object.enter (file:///Users/matb/projects/vscode/out/vs/base/common/winjs.base.raw.js:747:28)
    at _Base.Class.derive._creator._run (file:///Users/matb/projects/vscode/out/vs/base/common/winjs.base.raw.js:1068:29)
    at _Base.Class.derive._creator._setCompleteValue (file:///Users/matb/projects/vscode/out/vs/base/common/winjs.base.raw.js:1052:18)
```

When a workspace is opened, I do not see this

data.title: Extension recommendations should only be made if the user does not already have all recommended extensions

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
When I open vscode the editor shows a bar indicating there are extension recommendations, but I already have all recommended extensions installed. It should detect this scenario and prevent the recommendation banner.

- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.2 (cb82febafda0c8c199b9201ad274e25d9a76874e, 2017-07-19T23:22:50.650Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.7.0
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
xml|Dot|1.9.2
EditorConfig|Edi|0.9.4
material-icon-theme|PKi|2.0.11
vscode-docker|Pet|0.0.16
html-css-class-completion|Zig|1.8.0
html-snippets|abu|0.1.0
path-intellisense|chr|1.4.2
gitignore|cod|0.5.0
vscode-eslint|dba|1.2.11
python|don|0.6.9
vscode-babel-coloring|dza|0.0.4
vscode-npm-script|eg2|0.2.0
prettier-vscode|esb|0.21.0
php-debug|fel|1.11.1
php-intellisense|fel|1.4.3
docthis|joe|0.4.7
sublime-babel-vscode|jos|0.2.6
Go|luk|0.6.62
csharp|ms-|1.11.0
debugger-for-chrome|msj|3.1.6
php-docblocker|nei|1.2.0
Ruby|reb|0.12.1
sass-indented|rob|1.4.1
vim|vsc|0.9.0

(1 theme extensions excluded)


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Add `.vscode/extensions.json` with
```
{
	// See http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=827846
	// for the documentation about the extensions.json format
	"recommendations": [
    // Extension identifier format: ${publisher}.${name}. Example: vscode.csharp
    "dzannotti.vscode-babel-coloring",
    "msjsdiag.debugger-for-chrome",
    "EditorConfig.editorconfig",
    "dbaeumer.vscode-eslint",
    "esbenp.prettier-vscode"
	]
}
```
2. Launch vscode

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.15.0-insider (9b6cc9f774f424b4e8a91d4a2d3d4ad8efb9cfb9, 2017-07-24T05:07:43.734Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.6.0
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
vscode-docker|Pet|0.0.16
quokka-vscode|Wal|1.0.41
crazy|kie|0.0.1
githistory|don|0.2.2
python|don|0.6.9
tslint|eg2|0.17.0
vscode-npm-script|eg2|0.2.0
vsc-travis-ci-status|fel|1.1.0
svgpreview|kis|0.2.0
Go|luk|0.6.62
mssql|ms-|1.1.0
github-issues-prs|ms-|0.3.1
debugger-for-chrome|msj|3.1.6
vscode-versionlens|pfl|0.19.1
Ruby|reb|0.12.1
kustovscode|sea|0.0.1
php-syntax-visualizer|vsc|0.0.1
vscode-open-in-github|ziy|1.2.7

(1 theme extensions excluded)


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. open a VS Code workspace on `master`, no open editors
2. search for `from 'electron'` in all `*.ts` files
3. click on the first search result and wait until TS is properly initialized
4. click on the second search result and select `ipcMain` in the editor
-> caret stops blinking, it takes several seconds until the underlying word is highlighted and occurrences are shown in the scrollbar (only happens after the reference code lenses are shown)

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: **Yes**

This is the [TS server log](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/1171339/tsserver-log.txt)

data.title: Windows 1.14.2 python view has "No symbol information for the file"
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.14.2 
- OS Version: Windows x86

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open Python file
2. Set syntax to Python
3. Ctrl-T to Show all Symbols

Reproduces without extensions: Yes, though --disable-extensions doesn't seem to have an effect, checked manually.

data.title: Building 1.14.2-ia32 fails at runtime: 'Loading "gc-signals" failed'; '%1 is not a valid Win32 application'
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

I'm attempting to produce a build of VSCode 1.14.2 via the GitHub tag, and running into issues creating a build for win32-ia32.

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.14.2 (built via GitHub tag)
- OS Version: Win7, 64-bit
- Node: 6.10.2
- npm: 3.10.10

Steps to Reproduce:

* Check out tag `1.14.2`, run `scripts/npm install`
* Create a build with `npm run gulp -- vscode-win32-ia32`

<details>

```
> npm run gulp -- vscode-win32-ia32                                                                                                              
                                                                                                                                                 
> code-oss-dev@1.14.2 gulp C:\Users\IGEN261\code\github\vscode-fresh

```

</details>

* Try running `Code - OSS.exe` - it launches, but into a blank window:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/389077/28544504-0b8b465e-7089-11e7-8157-535d0c222ed0.png)

* Opening Dev Tools shows these errors:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/389077/28544538-2bcc6a4c-7089-11e7-8ef4-961c9f9ff3f1.png)

* I am able to successfully create and run a `win32-x64` build, as info.

I'm not sure how to resolve this. There are a few other issues with this error, including https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/18253 but they don't seem to be related.

data.title: Output is all messed up when running apt install/remove in terminal
data.body: Seems related to the progress bar is uses.

data.title: Transparent proxy and uses users NT credentials
data.body:
Our network uses a transparent proxy and uses users NT credentials to authenticate to the proxy. In powershell I can create a WebClient object which will fail on all requests (Error 401 - Unauthorized) until I set UseDefaultCredentials = $true.

Sorry if this is a duplicate request. I searched and didn't find a match and closest one was for a customizable 'User Agent String'.

Please enable this functionality.
- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.2 (cb82febafda0c8c199b9201ad274e25d9a76874e, 2017-07-19T23:34:19.566Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.14393
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
PowerShell|ms-|1.4.1
vscode-icons|rob|7.10.1

---

Steps to Reproduce:

From Extensions I get no results when I select any of the 'Show' commands. Also when I 'Check for Updates' I'll get the 401 error.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Code Outline does not show class methods
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.14.2
- OS Version: 10.12.6

#### Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a class with methods
2. Open the Code Outline

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: `Yes`
Environment: `React Native with Typescript`
File extension: `tsx`
Typescript Version: `2.4.1`


## Test file

```tsx
import React, { Component } from 'react'
import { connect } from 'react-redux'
import redux from 'redux'
import {
  NavigationScreenProps,
  NavigationScreenConfigProps,
} from 'react-navigation'
import { ActionButton } from 'react-native-material-ui'

import { NavButton } from '@components'
import { updateTicket } from '@actions'
import { Store, Ticket } from '@models'
import NoTickets from './components/NoTickets'
import { Content } from './styles'
import TicketList from './components/TicketsList'

interface ConnectedDispatch {
  toggleSidebar(): void
  updateTicket(ticket: Ticket): void
}

interface ConnectedProps {
  tickets: Ticket[]
}

interface State {
  newTicketModalOpen: boolean
}

interface Props
  extends NavigationScreenProps<{}>,
    ConnectedDispatch,
    ConnectedProps {}

class Support extends Component<Props, State> {
  static navigationOptions = ({ navigation }: NavigationScreenConfigProps) => ({
    title: 'Support',
    headerLeft: (
      <NavButton
        iconName="menu"
        onPress={() => navigation.navigate('DrawerOpen')}
      />
    ),
    headerRight: (
      <NavButton
        text="FAQ"
        onPress={() => {})}
      />
    ),
  })

  state = {
    newTicketModalOpen: false,
  }

  toggleNewTicketModal() {

  }

  viewTicket(ticket: Ticket) {
  }

  addNewTicket() {
    this.props.navigation.navigate('NewTicket')
  }

  render() {
    return (
      <Content>
        {this.props.tickets.length === 0
          ? <NoTickets />
          : <TicketList
              tickets={this.props.tickets}
              viewTicket={a => this.viewTicket(a)}
            />}

        <ActionButton icon="add" onPress={() => this.addNewTicket()} />
      </Content>
    )
  }
}

const mapStateToProps = (state: Store) => ({
  tickets: state.tickets,
})

const mapDispatchToProps = (dispatch: redux.Dispatch<Store>) => ({
  updateTicket: (ticket: Ticket) => dispatch(updateTicket(ticket)),
})

export default connect<ConnectedProps, ConnectedDispatch, null>(
  mapStateToProps,
  mapDispatchToProps
)(Support)

```

## Code Outline Output
![screen shot 2017-07-24 at 2 16 12 pm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5962998/28537993-ab341dde-707a-11e7-9ac6-5dc67a5b2071.png)

Only shows static members

data.title: Could not install typings behind proxy
data.body:
From @dakisxx in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/24961#issuecomment-316960416:

- VS code `1.14.2` (doesn't work with latest insiders either - `1.15.0-insider`)
- Typescript `2.4.2`
- OS kubuntu, fish shell
```
NPM location: "/home/daniel/n/bin/npm" (explicit '--npmLocation'  provided)
Npm config file: /home/daniel/.cache/typescript/2.4/package.json
Updating types-registry npm package...
Error updating types-registry package: Command failed: "/home/daniel/n/bin/npm" install types-registry
Types registry file '/home/daniel/.cache/typescript/2.4/node_modules/types-registry/index.json' does not exist
Sending response: {"kind":"event::initializationFailed","message":"Command failed: \"/home/daniel/n/bin/npm\" install types-registry"}
Response has been sent.
```
Some notes:

1. If I try to manually run the same failing command from console: `"/home/daniel/n/bin/npm" install types-registry`, it works fine
2. Referenced file (`/home/daniel/.cache/typescript/2.4/package.json`) is empty (content is `{}`)
3. `Types registry file '/home/daniel/.cache/typescript/2.4/node_modules/types-registry/index.json' does not exist`. There is no `node_modules` under `/home/daniel/.cache/typescript/2.4/` - the only file there is an empty package.json
4. If I start code from console, it works:
```
NPM location: "/home/daniel/n/bin/npm" (explicit '--npmLocation'  provided)
Npm config file: /home/daniel/.cache/typescript/2.4/package.json
Updating types-registry npm package...
Updated types-registry npm package
```
Could it be that it doesn't use the proxy setting correctly? (I have a corporate proxy set in VScode settings and in $HTTP_PROXY)

data.title: July endgame
data.body:
## Endgame Schedule
- *July 26*, Code freeze for the Zurich endgame
- *July 31*, Code freeze for the Redmond & Zurich endgame
- *August 4*, Endgame done

---

### Zurich only

#### Wednesday, July 26
- [x] Code freeze at 6pm ZRH time
- [x] Ensure we have a green build on all platforms
- [x] All test items contain sufficiently comprehensive test descriptions by 8pm ZRH time

#### Thursday, July 27
- [x] [Test plan items](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues?q=is%3Aissue+label%3Atestplan-item+milestone%3A"July+2017") assigned
- [x] [All closed feature-requests either have a verification-needed or on-testplan tag](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues?q=label%3Afeature-request+-label%3Aon-testplan+-label%3Averification-needed+-label%3Aduplicate+milestone%3A%22July+2017%22+is%3Aclosed)
- [x] Testing
- [x] [Verification needed](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues?q=is%3Aissue+-label%3Averified+is%3Aclosed+label%3Averification-needed)
- [x] Remind team members to assign issues that they intend to fix to the July milestone

#### Friday, July 28
- [x] Fixing (self-assigned, milestone assigned)
- [x] [Verification](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues?q=is%3Aissue+label%3Abug+-label%3Averified+is%3Aclosed+-label%3Aduplicate+-label%3Ainvalid+-label%3Aas-designed+milestone%3A%22July+2017%22)
- [x] Release notes updated (check off in list below)
- [ ] Acknowledge pull requests in release notes (check off in list below)
- [x] Satellite modules/npm packages ready, version updated, smoke tested (check off in list below)

---

### Redmond & Zurich

#### Monday, July 31
- [x] Code freeze at 5pm PT
- [x] Ensure we have a green build on all platforms
- [x] All test items contain sufficiently comprehensive test descriptions by 6pm PT

#### Tuesday, August 1 - Zurich holiday
- [x] [Test plan items](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues?q=is%3Aissue+label%3Atestplan-item+milestone%3A"July+2017") assigned
- [x] [All closed feature-requests either have a verification-needed or on-testplan tag](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues?q=label%3Afeature-request+-label%3Aon-testplan+-label%3Averification-needed+-label%3Aduplicate+milestone%3A%22July+2017%22+is%3Aclosed)
- [x] Testing
- [x] [Verification needed](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues?q=is%3Aissue+-label%3Averified+is%3Aclosed+label%3Averification-needed)

#### Wednesday, August 2
- [x] Testing
- [x] Remind team members to assign issues that they intend to fix to the July milestone
- [x] Fixing (self-assigned, milestone assigned)
- [x] [Verification](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues?q=is%3Aissue+label%3Abug+-label%3Averified+is%3Aclosed+-label%3Aduplicate+-label%3Ainvalid+-label%3Aas-designed+milestone%3A%22July+2017%22)

#### Thursday, August 3
- [x] Fixing last issues
- [x] [Verification](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues?q=is%3Aissue+label%3Abug+-label%3Averified+is%3Aclosed+-label%3Aduplicate+-label%3Ainvalid+-label%3Aas-designed+milestone%3A%22July+2017%22)
- [x] Run [OSS tool](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-distro/blob/master/distro-tools/README.md) after merging shrink-wrap findings **endgame master**
  - *The LCA review of the ThirdPartyNotices.txt files is not needed anymore*
- [x] Check new OSS usage is entered into the [OSS registry](https://ossmsft.visualstudio.com/_apps/hub/ms.vss-oss-web.hub-oss) **endgame master**

#### Friday, August 4
- Satellite modules/npm packages ready, version updated, smoke tested
  - [x] vscode **@bpasero**
  - [x] yo generator **@aeschli**
  - [x] vsce **@joaomoreno**
  - [x] node-debugadapter-node **@weinand**
  - [x] node-debug **@weinand**
  - [x] node-debug2 **@roblourens**

- [ ] All issues [verified](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/wiki/Issue-Tracking#verification)
- [x] Fixing (only critical bugs - no string changes)
- [Smoketest](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/wiki/Smoke-Test)
  - [x] Windows - @xxxx 
  - [x] OS X - @xxxx
  - [x] Linux - @xxxx
- [x] All release notes updated - release notes are collected in a file named *`Month_Year.md`* in this [repo directory](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-docs/blob/vnext/release-notes/). This includes new features and notable fixes.

  - [ ] vscode-jscs **@chrisdias**
  - [x] vscode-tslint **@egamma**

  - [x] vscode-jshint **@kieferrm**
  - [x] vscode-recipes **@weinand**
  - [x] localization **@danyeh @michelkaporin**

- When done fixing/verifying and there are changes since last build at the end of day PT
  - [x] Trigger new insider build and publish it manually **@owner**

##### Friday/Monday
- [x] Disable continuous `insider` builds - **endgame master**
- [x] Branch code to `release/<x.y>` and release `master` - **endgame master**
- [x] Bump up the version in `package.json` - **endgame master**
- [x] Announce master is open for business **endgame master**
- [x] Polish release notes **@redmond**

##### Monday - Wednesday
- [x] Polish release notes **@redmond**
- [x] Cherry-pick hand-picked and reviewed changes to `release/<x.y>` **@owner**
- [x] Build `Insider` from `release/<x.y>` **endgame master**
- [x] Manually release `Insider` **endgame master**
- [ ] Documentation updated
  - [x] @alexandrudima
  - [x] @weinand
  - [x] @chrmarti

data.title: Allow configuration for location of integrated terminal
data.body: I usually prefer to work with my terminal to the right of the editor. It would be nice to have an option to set where the terminal shows. Thanks for all your great work!

data.title: Debug Console suppressing URL output to stderr when line is of form "x.x:# http://x.x:#"
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.2 (cb82febafda0c8c199b9201ad274e25d9a76874e, 2017-07-19T23:22:50.650Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
swagger-viewer|Arj|1.4.0
vscode-markdownlint|Dav|0.10.0
xml|Dot|1.9.2
vscode-docker|Pet|0.0.16
Bookmarks|ale|0.15.2
code-gnu-global|aus|0.2.2
githistory|don|0.2.2
CppSnippets|har|0.0.12
asciidoctor-vscode|joa|0.3.5
vscode-insertdatestring|jsy|2.1.0
Go|luk|0.6.62
vscode-clang|mit|0.2.2
mssql|ms-|1.1.0
cpptools|ms-|0.12.1
peep|nwa|0.0.5
code-spell-checker|str|1.3.2
gotimeformat|v4r|1.0.1



---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Short Go program:  
```
package main

import "fmt"
import "os"

func main() {
    fmt.Fprintln(os.Stderr, "x.y:1 http://x.y:1")
}
```
Should output: "x.y:1 http://x.y:1"
Outpust: "x.y:1 "
Running in terminal is fine and sending to stdout in debug console is also fine.  If character(s) after colon are not numeric, fine, if http:// is not there, fine, if either period is not there, fine.  Only when all conditions are met is the URL portion and everything after on line suppressed.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Cannot determine (need Go extension), but reproduces with ALL other extensions disabled.

data.title: Feature request , option to open Files externally
data.body: I am working with a python as well as excel sheet generation ,it would be great if there is an **option to open excel sheet externally** from vscode **_because excel sheet is not supported in vscode_**
